name: Praise The Strays
shortDescription: Working on animal rescue, spray neutering them, so they live healthy and longer, helping to get adopted in caring homes and shelters.
description: Animal welfare is affected by the surroundings, and the relationships human beings have with animals, and it is the responsibility of the human race to peacefully coexist with animals and treat them humanely and with respect. Across the globe, the animal community has faced severe hostility and has been subjected to mistreatment, torture, and abandonment by humans.

quote.quote: The greatness of a nation can be judged by the way its animals are treated.
quote.author: Mahatma Gandhi

timeline.name: Fund Raising for Pw Saviour foundation through Milaap
timeline.desc: For building a proper shelter for cats with special needs, an area was identified in a nearby complex in C.R.Park, New Delhi where the owner is ready to lease the land for making a shelter for these cats. Reinvigorate Foundation helped to raise the funds through the Milaap Fund Raising platform and pitch for donations to various corporates. We also rescue and spay-neuter stray cats, so they live healthily and disease free

name: Boiling Alive
shortDescription: Working on the management of climatic changes and encouraging people to reduce and reverse carbon footprints
description: Our initiative boiling alive strives to work toward pressing environmental issues. We all know that the growing climate change is drastically going to affect our future generations unless we do something about it. Something which is consistent and makes a greater collaborative and thought-provoking impact on the environmental issues

quote.quote: We are the first generation to feel the effect of climate change and the last generation who can do something about it.
quote.author: Barack Obama, Former President of the USA

timeline.name: E-Waste Collection Drive for Team Mark
timeline.desc: The 36 Kgs of e-waste collected by my team was given to e-waste cycle hub.

timeline.name: Go Green Tree Plantation Drive, K.L. Mehta School, Sector 10, Faridabad
timeline.desc: 800 saplings were planted in and around the premises of K.L. Mehta School,Faridabad. In our endeavor Lion's club Faridabad gave their wholehearted support on this project.

timeline.name: Sapling Plantation, NRI Complex
(Volunteering) From Waste to Wealth
timeline.desc: This project is volunteer work done under the mentorship of Shri Rakesh Khatri ji -the founder of Eco Roots Foundation through Swavalamban Challenge Fund (SCF- Window II) by Small Industries Development Bank of India (SIDBI). The project is titled "Social Upliftment of rural women in Gautambuddha Nagar of Uttar Pradesh through Sustainable Income Generation & Reviving of 7 Water Bodies by clearing them of Water Hyacinth." Since ,water hyacinth is a big problem for a lot of water bodies. The growth leads to the complete destruction of the water body as it leads to complete cut off of the sunlight penetrating into the water because of which rest of the ecosystem of the water body becomes non-existent. The simple solution to the above-mentioned problem is that the water hyacinth be removed so that the water body can be revived and the ecosystem would come back to life. Hence, the proposed project is for revival of 7 such water bodies around Gautambuddha Nagar of Uttar Pradesh. Along with reviving the water bodies, the proposed project is also going to provide income generation activities to the 140 women beneficiaries. These women beneficiaries would be provided with training in removal of water hyacinth to a 90% and then to make marketable useful products out of the extracted stems of water hyacinth. The project would solve two problems, one it would revive the water bodies which have become non-use worthy, namely 7 water bodies/ponds in 7 different villages of Gautambuddha Nagar of Uttar Pradesh. Two, it would provide sustainable income generation to the women beneficiaries in the villages right in their original habitation.

timeline.name: Save the Sparrow
timeline.desc: Under the able leadership and guidance of the Nest Man of India - Mr. Rakesh Khatri, the organization is helping towards birds and their conservation by making and installing bird houses across the country. We help to organise workshops in schools, institutions, colleges and various organizations to raise awareness on save the sparrow initiative and teach to build nests and install these to help save sparrow which is a one of the key element of our ecosystem.

timeline.name: Books, E-Waste, Old Clothes/Toys, Collection Drive
timeline.desc: The foundation collaborated with and donated uasable books and toys to an underprivileged schoolAnubhav Ek Ehsaas, The E-waste collected was donated to Saahas, Gurugram for recycling.

name: Let's Talk Periods
shortDescription: Working on menstrual health hygiene and menstrual kit donations to the underprivileged.
description: In our society talking about periods is taboo, this stigma attached to menstrual talk or maintaining selfhygiene needs to be broken. In developing countries like ours , women's choices of menstrual hygiene materials are often limited by the costs, availability and social norms. Adequate sanitation facilities and access to feminine hygiene products are one part of the solution. Along with this we also need to create a culture that welcomes discussion and makes adequate education for women and girls. There needs to be an awareness about periods and related hygiene, the diseases which women might catch if they don't stay hygienic during this time like using old clothes, using the same cloth for long periods etc. Our main motive is to spread this awareness amongst female that how important it is for them to stay clean and hygienic in this time. Our government has also taken initiative on providing female hygiene products as extremely cheap rates which many of women donâ€™t even know about as per our data and observation. We conduct awareness camps in underprivileged areas to educate them about the same.

quote.quote: All females deserve menstrual well-being, and that includes knowledge and reassurance about her body from the earliest possible age.
quote.author: Nikki Tajiri

timeline.name: Awareness Drive in Leh District
timeline.desc: Reinvigorate Foundation got the opportunity to collaborate with Shoqpa Foundation and conducted a workshop and open mic session to raise awareness on Menstrual hygiene on Menstrual Hygiene Day (MHD) observed on May 28, 2022 at Leh district to highlight the importance of good menstrual hygiene management. Rightly said by Ms.Dorma -a Research Assistant in an institution that periods are as normal as eating and drinking then why shy from it? We distributed 500 menstrual hygiene kits to the underprivileged.

timeline.name: Awareness Camp and Workshop at Garib Niwaj School, GK-2

name: Express To Liberate
shortDescription: Working on the mental health and well-being.
description: Express to liberate believes in achieving the un sustainable development goal of good health and well-being by focusing on mental health awareness and conducting workshops/seminar/webinars and awareness campaigns on issues related to mental well-being. Etl believes that free self-expression, even anonymous and authenticity of emotional, psychological and spiritual being is the ultimate power that lies in the hands of an individual which liberates from all projections, societal concerns and constantly paves a path towards self-development and living a happy life. We believe that the shackles and stereotypes of our society must be broken to encourage equality and acceptance for all.

quote.quote: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light
quote.author: Aristotle

timeline.name: Teen Screens and Mental Health
timeline.desc: An online open mic session was conducted which was attended by 130 teenagers where they openly, and candidly spoke on how they perceive the impact of screen time on their mental health and various issues relating to that.

timeline.name: Dance Movement Therapy Sessions
timeline.desc: A series of systematic training sessions and awareness campaigns were conducted with the aim to work on self-confidence, empathy, leadership, and analytical capability to solve problems or challenges during the times of pandemic when all were locked in their homes. Some expected outcomes of DMT are it helps in building relationships and overall concern for the well-being of others; It helps in developing self-esteem and a sense of belonging, Promotes laughter and fun while learning, Helps in improving self-discipline and motivation A bit about Our therapist for the session: Ms. Neeti Arora is an M.A. in clinical psychology, M.S in Psychotherapy, and a CID UNESCO Certified Creative Movement Facilitator. She is a National Awardee for Outstanding volunteer work in this field. She has organized and developed many Dance/ Movement therapy programs to meet the Client's needs. CLINICAL EXPERIENCE : Organization: Department of Preventive Cardiology at FortisEscorts Heart Institute &Research Centre (New Delhi). Worked as a Counsellor & Facilitator with the GET ACTIVE program with an NGO Called "SWASHRIT" on inculcating healthy and Active lifestyle habits among Children New Project Development called "We Care" was related to starting up a day-care

timeline.name: Campaign on Anxiety and Anxiety Disorders and Overthinking
timeline.desc: Seeing the need of the hour awareness campaigns with the help of Drama, art,music and webinars with expert Ms.Reshma Bhown-A developmental Psychologist and a Lecturer at Delhi University, IGNOU and MRIU to help demystify the coping Mechanism for Anxiety and Anxiety disorders.

timeline.name: Awareness Campaign on Social Anxiety Disorder
timeline.desc: Awareness Campaign through facts and figures, cartoons etc. was conducted on Social Anxiety disorders. A webinar was conducted with Dr.Swati Sharma for her take on Social Anxiety disorders and ways to conquer it.

timeline.name: World Teen Mental Wellness Day
timeline.desc: According to the American Psychological Association, Gen Z has the worst mental health of any generation. However, teens are dedicated to making a difference. According to Pulse, 64% of Gen Z say they want to achieve a healthier lifestyle for overall happiness, including a stronger self-care routine. Also, 94% consider mental health very important to their general well-being.Ultimately, raising awareness about mental healthand the importance of self-care can help improve an entire generation's mental wellness

timeline.name: The secret of Psychological well-being: from the lens of Women Leaders - International Women's Day
timeline.desc: The women leaders from various industries and countries were interviewed to capture the secret of their psychological well-being while struggling to reach where they are today. Women Interviewed were: Ms.Amrita Madan- Senior Vice Preseident - City Group-Newyork || Ms.Priya Khemka - Director, Client experience and Insight at NTT Ltd. || Ms.Anu Sehgal - Founder Digital Mills, Think co-working Spaces

timeline.name: Happiness Session at National Association for Blind
timeline.desc: The day is observed to spread awareness about the importance of happiness in our lives.It aims to spread the message that the progress of a nation should be about increasing human happiness and well-being, and not just growth of the economy. On this international happiness day ETL visited NAB National Association for Blind to spread in some happiness and cheer and to relieve some stress these children might be facing. The session started with a fun filled activity of introductory session in which a sound ball was passed to random children and whoever caught the ball because of sound introduced themselves - icebreaker.  Then we had various creative movement activities like dance Rhythm ,fun games and laughter dose etc.

timeline.name: Awareness Campaign on Abuse and its Impact on Mental Health Well-being
timeline.desc: Awareness on various kinds of abuses ,its impact and strategies to evade if possible or ways to report . the various topics covered under this were Financial abuse, Physical abuse,sexual abuse, emotional abuse and child abuse. April being the "world child abuse prevention month " - Dr. Anjali â€“ A renowned Senior pediatrician and adolescent Health Expert was interviewed to share knowledge on child abuse and what do if you witness one.

timeline.name: Bullying Awareness
timeline.desc: Awareness Campaign on Different types of Bullying , its Impact, Role of Bystander and What to Do if Faced by Bully in Different Situations

timeline.name: Series of Workshops by Dr. Pradeep Chadha, Director, B.R. Clinic
timeline.desc: A series of workshops attended by over 200 people was conducted by Dr. Pradeep Chadha, a Psychiatrist specialized in alternate therapy for anxiety disorders was taken to empower people with the tools to identify and help themselves to combat anxiety and anxiety disorders.

timeline.name: Session on Good Touch/Bad Touch was Conducted for Students of DAPS-1 School, Delhi Cantt.
timeline.desc: A session was conducted for primary school children of Delhi Area Primary School- 1 (DAPS-1 Army School) on'Good Touch & Bad Touch' . The session began with ice breaking activities to seize students attention and interest . Then they were asked age appropriate questions to sensitise them about feeling comfortable and uncomfortable, private parts and when it's an alarming situation -what steps they must do like saying loud NO, to running from that area and going to some person safe and must telling it to parent/teacher/guardian with whom they are comfortable with. Expressing what you feel is must - more so for children. Knowing about this will help them to be protected against sexual harassment or child abuse

timeline.name: Session for teacher of DAPS-2 on "Inclusion : A teacher's role without stress"
timeline.desc: The session was conducted on 30th September 2022 by our mentor and special educator - Ms. Reshma Bhown. The session was conducted to raise sensitivity for children with special needs to the teachers of DAPS-2 army school, Delhi t. Inclusiveness is to be dealt with very sensibly by all stakeholders and awareness has to be raised to all so that the students with disabilities can flourish in a real inclusive environment with good mental well-being

timeline.name: Session conducted for Teachers of DAPS-2 on "Helping boost Good mental Health for Students"
timeline.desc: We conducted sessions with the teachers of Delhi Area Primary School-II , Delhi cant. and empowered them to gain an idea about how to promote good mental health among all students. The workshop: In the Minds Eye, was a thrilling session conducted by Dr. Swati S. Soni, during which she provided the teachers with the means to help thousands of students in DAPS-ll not only to have good mental health for themselves but also to aid their peers.

timeline.name: Walk for Mental Health
timeline.desc: The awareness walk - "Walk for Mental Health and wellness" under the initiative Express to Liberate was conducted today -20th November 2022. Initiated by participants and volunteers, the walk kept attracting many people, who received informational flyers. As we proceeded towards Jahapanah forest many people appreciated the cause and joined in the walk leading to huge number of participation and a grand success till we reached the finishing point covering a stretch of 5+ kilometres. The walk clearly met its objective of spreading awareness and empowering people to take care of their own mental health and well-being. Team of Reinvigorate Foundation appreciates the enthusiasm and participation of all the joiners today.

name: Vitalising Lives
shortDescription: Helping the underprivileged by educating, skill development to live a better standard of living.
description: With millions of people deprived of education and employment there are a lot of dreams being cut short. When these people get the opportunities they deserve, the world begins to change; poverty goes down, economies grow, families get stronger and most importantly they become aware of their basic rights. Vitalizing lives is an initiative for taken to help these people lead a decent standard of living. We strive to provide them with sources for entertainment, study, sports to foster a healthy mind and body. We encourage people to donate their pre-loved possessions like old books, clothes, accessories, comic books, board games etc. Which are in a reusable condition, to further provide to disadvantaged children. Further, we conduct drives to make these young adults work-ready by conducting computer literacy drives, communication classes, handicraft classes etc.

quote.quote: The meaning of life is to find your gift. The purpose of life is to give it away.
quote.author: Pablo Picasso

timeline.name: Communication Classes for Underprivileged Students
timeline.desc: The main problem identified while taking classes for students with limited means is their employability as they enter the job markets. The reason -Simple! Lack of communication skills. We took communication classes for these students, centered around helping them converse better to make them Job Ready. We also created some modules for these children in Hindi and English to empower them by having access to resources for improving their communication skills on their own. This has now become our flagship program wherein we are tying up Garib Niwaj school and evening online classes with underprivileged students in association with Be Dauntless Foundation to give communication classes to enhance their communication skills and their confidence and make them job ready

timeline.name: Series of Workshops of Sustainable Saleable for Specially abled Children
timeline.desc: Reinvigorate foundation conducted a series of workshops on Saturdays and Sundays making eco-friendly raisin salable for the specially abled children of Prabhat - An awakening in Faridabad. The objective of the workshops was to involve them in fine motor skills, channelize their energy, and put it into creativity. These children learned to make beautiful eco-friendly coasters, trays, bookmarks, test tube vases, beads jewelry etc., which will be part of saleable in Melas organized around various festivals and Flea markets.

timeline.name: Book Donation Drive
timeline.desc: A book donation drive was organized in Guru Nanak Garib Niwaj Education Society where course books were donated to High school Students and books relating to various interests, ages, encyclopedias were donated to set up their library.

timeline.name: Awareness Camp for Atal Tinkering Lab for Students of Garib Niwaj School, GK-2 under MRIS Charmwood
timeline.desc: 15 students of Garib Niwaj School, GK-2 were taken to give them exposure to STEM and Robotics Under ATAL innovation Mission of Government to the Atal Community Day organized by Manav Rachna International School, Charmwood, Faridabad. Here they were shown how to build basic circuits, Traffic light working, 3 -D printing and laser cutting.

timeline.name: Educational Activities, Spreading Fun and Food Distribution to Children with Special Needs of Prabhat Foundation
